# Project Portfolio

The following details projects and other specific experiences that may be noteworthy to employers or helpful during interviews. This is to act as a "project portfolio" based on the work I have achieved rather than the job title I held.

## Data Analysis - Expanding Agrivoltaics in Colorado

### Project Details

-   Undergraduate project that led to the work with AgriSolar

-   Data analysis using GIS software to understand the best places for agrivoltaics in the state of Colorado

-   Various data sets and analysis techniques including raster weighted overlays

-   Project presentation and communication using ArcGIS StoryMaps and Experience Builder

### Project Deliverables

Link to final StoryMap: [Expanding Solar Development in Colorado](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/655154129ec64e5899b418453b5ad377)

Link to Experience Builder: [Suitable Areas for Agrivoltaics in Colorado](https://experience.arcgis.com/experience/381aa33c5d3a4e5c856da41675c08e00)

## Data Analysis - Suitability for Voluntary Carbon Market Projects in a Peruvian National Park

### Project Details

-   Completed as my undergraduate capstone project

-   Analyzed the suitability for reforestation and peatlands restoration in a Peruvian National Park for carbon credit in the voluntary carbon market

-   Utilized remote sensing and geospatial analysis techniques to identify areas in a specific valley with high reforestation potential and peatlands remediation potential

-   Presented a StoryMao of findings and shared results with other students working on identifying the carbon sequestration potential

### Project Deliverables

Link to final StoryMap: [Reforestation & Peatlands Expansion Potential](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/f9558ad6df5e49c09aa54917c00c9b57)

## Undergraduate Research

### Project Details

-   Worked on a year-long undergraduate research project on creating K-12 lesson plans on population modelling of wild horses and common fertility management practices

-   Created maps for 4 different levels to understand where wild horses are managed in the western US

-   Traveled to a Herd Management area to understand western ecology dynamic in the field while photographing wild horses

-   Presented a research poster at the end of the project

    -   Awarded Warner College Honors for poster presentation at Celebrate Undergraduate Research & Creativity
